info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 8:22PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pender, southeastern Bladen, central Brunswick, Columbus and northeastern Horry Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 822 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cherry Grove, or 13 miles southwest of Whiteville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leland, Whiteville, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Bethel, Lake Waccamaw, Northwest, Sandyfield, Makatoka, Hallsboro, Exum, Longwood, Southeastern Community College, Winnabow, Honey Island, Sidney, Clarendon, Town Creek and Longs. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 27 and 29, and between mile markers 35 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
